message.content:
cs.DC, cs.CR, cs.Distributed, cs.CY, cs.SY. 

The paper proposes a new Byzantine fault-tolerant (BFT) protocol for blockchain consensus that is fast and scalable. This suggests that the paper is likely to belong to the Distributed Computing (cs.DC) sub-category, which deals with the design, analysis, and implementation of distributed systems. The paper also mentions the use of hardware-based trusted execution environments (TEEs) and secret sharing, which are techniques commonly used in the field of computer security (cs.CR). Additionally, the paper discusses the integration of BFT protocols into blockchain technology, which falls under the category of Cryptography and Security (cs.CY). The paper also mentions the use of failure detection, which is a topic in the Systems and Control (cs.SY) sub-category. Overall, the most likely sub-categories are cs.DC, cs.CR, and cs.CY, followed by cs.CY and cs.SY.
